issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
*Assessment*

If a cloud user runs an EBS-backed EMI with a block-device-mapping option to attach a volume of a given size, the volume is not seen by the instance upon boot.  All components show that the volume has been exported correctly, and attached to the instance, but it is never seen on boot. 
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-run-instances -k account1-user01 -t m1.medium emi-F0AE2A00 --block-device-mapping "/dev/sdf=:5" --region account1-user01@
RESERVATION	r-9D92BBBF	408396244283	default
INSTANCE	i-E8FF78A8	emi-F0AE2A00			pending	account1-user01	0		m1.medium	2014-06-16T17:47:14.068Z	ViciousLiesAndDangerousRumors				monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			ebs					hvm			sg-A5133B59
...
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-describe-instances i-E8FF78A8 --region account1-user01@
RESERVATION	r-9D92BBBF	408396244283	default
INSTANCE	i-E8FF78A8	emi-F0AE2A00	euca-10-104-6-233.bigboi.acme.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-172-18-238-143.bigboi.internal	running	account1-user01	0		m1.medium	2014-06-16T17:47:14.068Z	ViciousLiesAndDangerousRumors				monitoring-disabled	10.104.6.233	172.18.238.143			ebs					hvm			sg-A5133B59
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/sdf	vol-4F233459	2014-06-16T17:47:14.284Z	true
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/sda	vol-12EF8A61	2014-06-16T17:47:14.392Z	true

### from within the instance ###

[root@odc-f-13 ~]# ssh -i account1-user01/account1-user01.priv ubuntu@euca-10-104-6-233.bigboi.acme.eucalyptus-systems.com

ubuntu@euca-172-18-238-143:~$ lsblk
NAME   MAJ:MIN RM SIZE RO TYPE MOUNTPOINT
vda    253:0    0   2G  0 disk
└─vda1 253:1    0   2G  0 part /
vdb    253:16   0   5G  0 disk
ubuntu@euca-172-18-238-143:~$ ls /dev/vd*
/dev/vda  /dev/vda1  /dev/vdb

ubuntu@euca-172-18-238-143:~$ dmesg | grep vd
[    0.381897]  vda: vda1
[    0.399621]  vdb: unknown partition table
[    0.592177] systemd-udevd[96]: starting version 204
[    1.806995] EXT4-fs (vda1): mounted filesystem with ordered data mode. Opts: (null)
[    2.714532] EXT4-fs (vda1): re-mounted. Opts: (null)
[    3.333925] systemd-udevd[323]: starting version 204
{code}

This causes issues with tools like [overlayroot |http://blog.dustinkirkland.com/2012/08/introducing-overlayroot-overlayfs.html] where cloud users can overlay the root filesystem on a separate block device.

*Steps*

# Set up Eucalyptus 4.0.0 cloud
** Eucalyptus DNS enabled
** with multiple UFS
** managed networking mode
** topology
*** 1 x CLC
*** 1 x UFS
*** 1 x UFS, Walrus
*** 1 x CC/SC (overlay)
**** CC is gateway for NCs
*** 2 x NC
# Create EBS-backed EMI with 2 gig EBS volume.  Steps can be referenced from [the KB article regarding creating an EBS-backed EMI|https://support.eucalyptus.com/hc/en-us/articles/201605884-Creating-an-Ubuntu-EBS-backed-EMI-from-an-Existing-Instance-Store-Backed-Instance].
# After the EBS-backed EMI has been created, launch it with block device mapping option.  For example:
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-run-instances -k account1-user01 -t m1.medium emi-F0AE2A00 --block-device-mapping "/dev/sdf=:5" --region account1-user01@
RESERVATION	r-9D92BBBF	408396244283	default
INSTANCE	i-E8FF78A8	emi-F0AE2A00			pending	account1-user01	0		m1.medium	2014-06-16T17:47:14.068Z	ViciousLiesAndDangerousRumors				monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			ebs					hvm			sg-A5133B59
{code}
# Run euca-describe-instances and observe the volumes associated with the instance
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-describe-instances i-E8FF78A8 --region account1-user01@
RESERVATION	r-9D92BBBF	408396244283	default
INSTANCE	i-E8FF78A8	emi-F0AE2A00	euca-10-104-6-233.bigboi.acme.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-172-18-238-143.bigboi.internal	running	account1-user01	0		m1.medium	2014-06-16T17:47:14.068Z	ViciousLiesAndDangerousRumors				monitoring-disabled	10.104.6.233	172.18.238.143			ebs					hvm			sg-A5133B59
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/sdf	vol-4F233459	2014-06-16T17:47:14.284Z	true
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/sda	vol-12EF8A61	2014-06-16T17:47:14.392Z	true
{code}
# SSH into the instance and notice the volume is not attached:
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# ssh -i account1-user01/account1-user01.priv ubuntu@euca-10-104-6-233.bigboi.acme.eucalyptus-systems.com
ubuntu@euca-172-18-238-143:~$ lsblk
NAME   MAJ:MIN RM SIZE RO TYPE MOUNTPOINT
vda    253:0    0   2G  0 disk
└─vda1 253:1    0   2G  0 part /
vdb    253:16   0   5G  0 disk
{code}

*Signs*

* output of euca-describe-instances:
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-describe-instances i-E8FF78A8 --region account1-user01@
RESERVATION	r-9D92BBBF	408396244283	default
INSTANCE	i-E8FF78A8	emi-F0AE2A00	euca-10-104-6-233.bigboi.acme.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-172-18-238-143.bigboi.internal	running	account1-user01	0		m1.medium	2014-06-16T17:47:14.068Z	ViciousLiesAndDangerousRumors				monitoring-disabled	10.104.6.233	172.18.238.143			ebs					hvm			sg-A5133B59
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/sdf	vol-4F233459	2014-06-16T17:47:14.284Z	true
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/sda	vol-12EF8A61	2014-06-16T17:47:14.392Z	true
{code}
* output of euca-describe-volumes of volumes associated with instance
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-describe-volumes vol-4F233459 vol-12EF8A61 --region account1-user01@
VOLUME	vol-4F233459	5		ViciousLiesAndDangerousRumors	in-use	2014-06-16T17:47:14.155Z	standard
ATTACHMENT	vol-4F233459	i-E8FF78A8	/dev/sdf	attached	2014-06-16T17:47:14.284Z
VOLUME	vol-12EF8A61	2	snap-3DAA6395	ViciousLiesAndDangerousRumors	in-use	2014-06-16T17:47:14.284Z	standard
ATTACHMENT	vol-12EF8A61	i-E8FF78A8	/dev/sda	attached	2014-06-16T17:47:14.392Z
{code}

{code}

fields.summary: Empty Volume Attached at euca-run-instances through block-device-mapping Doesn't Actually Attach
fields.environment:
* 1 x CLC
* 1 x UFS
* 1 x UFS, Walrus
* 1 x CC/SC (Overlay)
* 2 x NCs

comments.body:
[~hspencer], I see the 5GB volume, specified on the run instance path, inside the instance. 

{noformat}
### from within the instance ###

[root@odc-f-13 ~]# ssh -i account1-user01/account1-user01.priv ubuntu@euca-10-104-6-233.bigboi.acme.eucalyptus-systems.com

ubuntu@euca-172-18-238-143:~$ lsblk
NAME   MAJ:MIN RM SIZE RO TYPE MOUNTPOINT
vda    253:0    0   2G  0 disk
└─vda1 253:1    0   2G  0 part /
vdb    253:16   0   5G  0 disk
{noformat}

Am I missing something here?

Hey [~swathi],

Apologies for getting back to you so late on this.  I got confused by the output from the VM type that I used.  The behavior is correct.  I double-checked against AWS and saw that the behavior was consistent.  Thanks for checking this out.

*AWS Confirmation*
{code}
$ aws ec2 run-instances --image-id ami-7a549412 --key-name harold-euca --profile harold-work --instance-type m3.xlarge --block-device-mappings "[{\"DeviceName\": \"/dev/sdf\",\"Ebs\":{\"VolumeSize\":50}}]
....
$ ssh -i ~/.ec2/euca-work-keypairs/harold-euca.pem ubuntu@ec2-54-242-9-55.compute-1.amazonaws.com
...
ubuntu@ip-10-185-187-254:~$ lsblk
NAME  MAJ:MIN RM SIZE RO TYPE MOUNTPOINT
xvdf  202:80   0  50G  0 disk
xvda1 202:1    0   8G  0 disk /
{code}
